answers.answer: It could be, but is not a particularly common symptom. It seems a bit long past menopause to still have hot flashes. Did you stop getting them and then start again? If I were you I would be more apt to check and make sure your thyroid was stable. Sometimes the thyroid meds need tweaking. As for blood glucose, simple enough to get a home meter and check it!

question: Hi I have Hypothyroidism for which I am taking 100mg Levothyroxine. I am also pre- diabetic. I am 62 years old. Had my menopause at 50. I still get hot flushes . Can happen at any time in the day. I'm wondering now whether these burning hot flushes can be  my blood glucose reaching high levels.Is this hot flush syndrome a symptom of diabetes?
title: burning question!
